page.title: 02A Visit to Veddoes Farm
page.content: The farm is mainly a cattle and dairy farm. The land is owned by Hereford and Worcester County Council and Mr. Barrell is a tenant farmer. He has seventy-four acres of land of which ninety-eight percent is grassland. He has eight fields and one orchard. He sells his cider apples to Bulmers. In one of the fields he grows potatoes which is a new crop for him. He also grows turnips as a winter food for animals. He has two woods and most of the trees are oak or ash. His main income comes from dairy farming. He has ninety cattle, fifty-one of these give milk. He gets nine hundred and forty litres of milk a day, or three hundred and ten thousand litres a year. It is all sold to Cadburys, the chocolate company.
